text: Grosse Ile Township is a town in Wayne County in the U.S. state of Michigan. The township is coterminous with the island in the Detroit River called Grosse Ile. The name comes from French, meaning "Big Island". The population was 10,788 at the 2020 census. It is part of the collection of communities known as Downriver. ==References== Category:Townships in Michigan
title: Grosse Ile Township, Michigan
